title: Saga adds new China cruise
text:
Saga adds new China cruise 3 July 2015 | By Edward Robertson Save 
A new tour and Yangtze cruise itinerary is being offered by Saga, taking in many of China’s must-see sights for the first-time visitor. 
The itinerary begins in Shanghai before an internal flight to Yichang to join the river vessel. Four nights’ sailing takes in the Three Gorges Dam before a tributary is explored. Two nights are then spent in Chongqing to view the Unesco-protected 7th-century Dazu rock carvings, the Hongya Cave and traditional-style stilted buildings. 
A bullet train journey to Chengdu takes clients to the Panda Breeding Centre and to the Bronze Age City of Sanxingdui. Other highlights include a journey along the Li river, a visit to a tea plantation, the Terracotta Warriors and three nights in Beijing. 
The 17-night tour leads in at £2,899pp including UK chauffeur transfers, accommodation, all flights, most meals, visa and insurance. It runs from April to November 2016. 
Saga is also introducing a new river cruise from Prague, with a 724-mile journey along the river Elbe. 
The operator’s Beauty of Bohemia cruise includes a visit to Dresden and Pirna, in the former East Germany, which Canaletto painted 11 times. 
The 10-night package starts from £1,299pp, departing Heathrow, Manchester and Edinburgh on April 15, 2016. It includes four excursions, gratuities and porterage. A two-night post-tour extension at Prague’s five-star Corinthia Hotel can be added on.
